alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 26 at 5:57AM PDT until September 28 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. Breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet are possible. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor beach erosion and tidal overflows may occur this evening.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or swim near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
